text: Margaret Isobel Fulton OAM (10 October 1924 - 24 July 2019)Australian Biography Interview was a Scottish-born Australian food and cooking 'guru', writer, journalist, author, and commentator. She was the first of this genre of writers in Australia.Australian Biography , accessed 1 May 2007 She was born in Nairn, Scotland. Fulton's best known work was writing The Margaret Fulton Cookbook and for hosting Recipes from the Duchess of Duke Street. Fulton was awarded the Medal of the Order of Australia in the 1983 Queen's Birthday Honours "In recognition of service to the media as a journalist and writer in the field of cookery". Fulton died on 24 July 2019 at the age of 94.Margaret Fulton, who inspired Australians to undertake culinary adventures, is dead at 94 ==References== ==Other websites== * Official Website * Australian Biography Online * 1 May 2007, ABC call for "Favourite Margaret Fulton Memory" Category:1924 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Australian writers Category:Chefs
title: Margaret Fulton
